Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Not sure if this problem is on Signal Android's end or on Signal Desktop's. One of my SMS (non-Signal) contacts just got synched with Signal Desktop after changing its color on Signal Android, i. e. the contact is (was) listed on Signal Desktop's contact list - not the conversation. After exiting Signal Desktop and starting it again, that contact magically disappeared again. Edit: I've been able to reproduce this a second time and updated this issue with new debug logs for Signal Android and Signal Desktop. All logs are now taken directly after the issue happened. Potentially related issue: WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop#903 Steps to reproduce Change color of a non-Signal contact Start Signal Desktop Actual result: Contact shows up on Signal Desktop Expected result: Contact shouldn't show up on Signal Desktop Device info Device: Google Nexus 5 Android version: 6.01 Signal version: 3.19.1 Debug logs: Signal Android directly after changing contact color Signal Desktop directly after contact appeared and is still present Signal Desktop after contact disappeared again
Manager.title: SMS only, non-Signal Android contact showing up on Signal Desktop after changing its color

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Android 7.0 (Nougat) adds bundled notifications which allows the app to group notifications in a way that lets the user expand the group to work with each notification individually (https://developer.android.com/about/versions/nougat/android-7.0.html#notification_enhancements). Currently, when Signal has notifications from two or more conversations, the notifications are grouped together into one notification that cannot be expanded, preventing the user from preforming quick actions on the notifications without entering the app. Implementing the new notification feature will allow Signal to continue to group notifications with the added benefit of preforming quick actions on each notification individually. Screenshots Bundled notifications example (from https://developer.android.com/about/versions/nougat/android-7.0.html) Device info Device: Nexus 5X Android version: 7.0.0 üëç 2
Manager.title: Add support for bundled notifications (Android 7.0)

Manager.description: In order to counter shoulder surfing an option could be added to show a contact in: name + (wherever possible) phone number (as is currently done and default option name only (no phone numbers are shown anywhere unless contact is not in address book phone numbers only (no names are shown anywhere, only initial letter in contact avatar) (alternatively as name, the same initial could be used as is used for the contact's avatar) Places where this applies is the overview of contacts, a dialogue, notification drawer et cetera. Implementing would greatly counter shoulder surfing in terms of with whom one is commuicating.
Manager.title: Option to display contact in terms of name and/or number

Manager.description: I want to see Signal to have a setting where it can automatically create a backup on the phone of it's messages (SMS/MMS/etc) and the key set, in a bundle that I can backup to my servers (for example, to ownCloud). There's already a way to export to clear text, but this doesn't backup the keys. And, this is manual. I need this, otherwise wiping my device, or switching to a new one, is going to be painful. Or, to put it another way, if my phone is lost, so is all my messaging. Who isn't an advocate for backups? Please?
Manager.title: [Feature Request] Automatic backups/exports (as an option)

Manager.description: We need a per-contact setting to disable secure messaging, and just use regular SMS. Why? I have come across contacts who are incorrectly considered to be Signal users. That is to say: Signal wants to send them encrypted messages over data, but these people do not have Signal installed, and claim to have never used Signal or TextSecure previously. I assume the issue comes about from mobile number re-use.
Manager.title: Need way to persistently mark contact as insecure contact

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When Signal is called from the "Recent Apps List", or "Overview" the user is properly returned to the window they were last using. However, When Signal is selected from App Drawer, or Home, the conversation list is always displayed as if first being run. This is nonstandard from other messenger apps and does not give the user the functionality they expect. Steps to reproduce Select Signal from either Home or App Drawer Select a conversation Press the Home Key Select Signal from home or App Drawer Actual result: When selecting signal from either the app drawer or home screen you are always presented with the same conversation list. Expected result: A New user expects selecting signal from the app drawer or home screen to return to the last open window (be it the last conversation, setting screen, etc) just as if they selected it from the recent apps list.
Manager.title: Signal Icon in App Drawer/Home should return the user to last viewed screen.

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When you change the disappearing message timer, a notification appears, but whether that notification hangs around depends on whether you're in a group vs. contact thread. Steps to reproduce Given I'm in a group thread When I enable the (unreleased) disappearing messages feature And set the timer to 5 seconds Then I see the "You set disappearing message time to 5 seconds." In five seconds that info message is deleted. Given I'm in a contact thread When I enable the (unreleased) disappearing messages feature And set the timer to 5 seconds Then I see the "You set disappearing message time to 5 seconds." The info message never gets deleted. Actual result: Contact thread "You set disappearing message time" info messages are never deleted. Expected result: Primarily I expect the Contact thread info message to be deleted. Though if you could make a case for why the notification should remain, then at least it should be consistent across group and contact threads.
Manager.title: Disappearing message notification disappears in group thread but not in contact thread

Manager.description: Link Android and Desktop with disappearing messages support Go to conversation list on Android Open a conversation on Desktop Receive a 10s disappearing message on Desktop Note that it is also received and marked read in the Android conversation list Wait 10 seconds Actual result: Message expires from Desktop, but is still readable Android Expected result: Message expires on both clients at about the same time Note that it's not enough to start the timer when marking the message read. You have to back-date it by looking at the send time of the read receipt itself in case your client has been offline for a while.
Manager.title: Use read receipt envelope timestamp to infer startExpirationTime of disappearing messages

Manager.description: The Android Play Services and play-services-maps were upgraded from 8.1.0 to 9.4.0, but the checksums in build.gradle (line 107 and 108) were not changed, so the build fails. Removing the lines solved the issue, but the checksums have to be updated. The same holds for com.android.support:appcompat, com.android.support:recyclerview, com.android.support:cardview, com.android.support:design, com.google.android.gms:play-services-base, com.google.android.gms:play-services-basement and com.android.support:support-v4. I wonder how OWS builds the project. Are there things not checked in or do they disable the checksums completely? After that, the build fails with Signal-Android\build\intermediates\res\merged\debug\values-v23\values-v23.xml Error:(4) Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'android:TextAppearance.Material.Widget.Button.Inverse'. Error:(34) Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'android:Widget.Material.Button.Colored'. I'm still working on that one.

Manager.description: One of the requests that came out of the work to improve photo quality (#672) was the ability to simply send photos exactly as they are, without reprocessing them. In the other thread, there are many good reasons why there isn't an option to handle photos that way, dealing with the previews, display, memory limitations, etc. It occurs to me that the way to allow this option to those that need it - and also provide more utility overall - is to provide an option to send arbitrary file types - including photos - without processing them. There are currently choices for Images, Audio, Video when sending a message. Just give us an option for "Files". Add an option to the attachment area for "File". If we pick a picture via the file option, instead of the image option, we just send the image exactly as is with no processing / preview / etc. The bonus is it now works for any file type.... and I can finally send full resolution images without having to revert to e-mail or something like that. Giving us the ability to push them through as files, however, bypasses a all of the issues related to device memory, preview, etc. Following the existing UI design / pattern gives the user customizability over what is downloaded (and when - only wifi, etc). It also now lets us send any other document securely, which would be a great bonus. Not sure what the upper limit needs to be on the file size... but even if it was as low as 10 MBs, we could send full resolution photos.
Manager.title: Enhance Signal to allow transfer of arbitrary file types

Press push to talk. Send voice note. Actual result: Voice note is send. Since it is transmitted via GSM it is converted to an MMS message. And MMS messages are extremely expensive. I pay 0.49‚Ç¨ for a single one. I know that in other countrys you pay a lot less, if at all. So I wanted to you to be aware of it. Expected result: I don't know really know to be honest. Just hide it in sms mode works for me. But at the same time is probably quite annoying for someone who does not have to pay for mms messages and would like to use that feature even in sms mode. Differentiate userbase for location and mms fees and hide/show push-to-talk button accordingly is probably a PITA. Sorry no easy solution here. But I can see people using the voice-notes. And paying a hefty bill afterwards. Which, although it is the users fault, could lead to bad Signal reputation. Screenshots Device info Device: should not matter Android version: should not matter Signal version: 3.23.0 Cheers, have a nice day Link to debug log üëç 1

Manager.description: Hi. I am Pradip Sikdar, a visually challenged android intermediate user. I have started using Signal Private Messanger for Android recently and most of the part, I am quite happy with it. As you know, we use screen reader technology to use our android or IOS devices. So, if there is a menu or button which is not properly tagged or labled, the screen reader doesn't recognize it. For example, let's say there is a play button. Visually there is a sign or graphics which represents that, it is a play button. But if the button is not properly tagged or labled as "Play" button, our screen reader only says "Button Unlabled". So, we cannot recognize what the button is. So, I am here by requesting to the developer of this nice application, to lable all the buttons of this application. For example, when I am clicking on the "toggle attachment" button, I am getting some additional buttons which are not labled. So, I cannot recognize them. Thanks in advance from all the blind community. Pradip üëç 4

Manager.title: Signal is censored in Cuba

Manager.description: Hello, There was a case in Germany some months ago, where a suspects end-to-end messenger traffic has been decrypted by the German police. In this case it was the application telegram. But I started thinking about this issue, and maybe the same hack could be used with signal too. You might know that signal has a desktop application. The German police used a desktop Application like this to get access to the messages of the suspect. They just requested access to a desktop application, man-in-the-middle'd the incoming Activation-SMS, and had full access to the messages. [1] Is this possible with Signal, too? It would be nice to have an option to disable multiple clients [1] https://motherboard.vice.com/de/read/exklusiv-wie-das-bka-telegram-accounts-von-terrorverdaechtigen-knackt (GERMAN, sorry no english version available)
Manager.title: [feature-request] Possibility to disable multiple clients

("Not delivered. Tap for details"). Apparently the message went through nonetheless and not just once but multiple times and is displayed at all recipients multiple times (group chat). Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Feature Request Could it be possible to remove the contact pic preceding every message (chat bubble) in a conversation in order to reduce the clutter and also make things consistent with the iOS and Desktop versions? Detailed Description While the presence of contact pics before messages is helpful in group conversations (but still overwhelming when multiple messages are sent by the same person in succession as mentioned in #964), they are extremely redundant and make the screen more busy in one-to-one conversations. The colour of the chat bubbles is already an excellent method of distinguishing between messages. While doing something along the lines of other messaging apps (QKSMS, Hangouts, Facebook Messenger or Google Messenger) is what #964 sought by requesting that successive messages from the same contact be bundled, with the contact pic appearing only once for one message bundle, I am suggesting going the WhatsApp route and doing away with contact pics entirely, at least in individual conversation where they add very little, especially in excess. Doing so would have the added benefit of making the Android app consistent with the iOS and Desktop apps where the contact pic doesn't appear within conversations. The desktop app instead displays the contact pic in the action bar which could be one alternate location for displaying the contact pic. Also, hopefully there should be no database issues in implementing this change like was mentioned in that other issue and that might expedite its implementation as it would be a purely UI move? Screenshots Here are the iOS and desktop versions respectively: Here is how WhatsApp handles things presently: The contact pic is relegated to the action bar and messages bubbles only carry the name of the contact. Of course, even the name isn't present in case of individual conversations but I couldn't get a screenshot of that on the Play Store. üëç 3
Manager.title: Remove Contact Pic Preceding Messages From Within Individual Conversations

Manager.description: feature request: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/text/image-keyboard.html Users often want to communicate with emojis, stickers, and other kinds of rich content. In previous versions of Android, soft keyboards (also known as input method editors or IMEs) could send only unicode emoji to apps. For rich content, apps had to either build app-specific APIs that couldn't be used in other apps or use workaround like sending images through Easy Share Action or the clipboard. With Android 7.1 (API level 25), the Android SDK includes the Commit Content API, which provides a universal way for IMEs to send images and other rich content directly to a text editor in an app. The API is also available in v13 Support Library as of revision 25.0.0. We recommend using the Support Library because it runs on devices as early as Android 3.2 (API Level 13), and it contains helper methods that simplify implementation. With this API, you can build messaging apps that accept rich content from any keyboard, as well as, keyboards that can send rich content to any app. The Google Keyboard and apps like Google Messenger support the Commit Content API in Android 7.1
Manager.title: Image Keyboard Support

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I'm experiencing an issue with regular unencrypted MMS messages. Signal will receive and display the MMS message normally however after another 3 days it will display the same message a second time even though the sender only sent it along once. I switched my phone back to the stock SMS app (Google Messenger) for a while to see if I could reproduce the same behavior. Google Messenger displays MMS message a single time as expected. This behavior has been consistent for me since I installed Signal and it does not seem to matter what phone OS (Android or iOS) or messaging application (iMessage, etc.) the sender is using. Possibly related issues: #6003 #5525 Steps to reproduce Get a friend to send along a single MMS message Notice that the MMS message is received and displayed by your phone normally Wait 3 days Notice that the MMS message is received and displayed by Signal a second time Actual result: Single MMS messages are being received and displayed twice by Signal. Expected result: MMS messages are only received and display once in Signal. Screenshots https://goo.gl/photos/jFyRb3jeS8s9sshZ8 Notice the sent and received dates of both images. Device info Device: LGE Nexus 5X Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.27.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d166776852cf019e7c9552e2ee2ebfb2 Log was captured after MMS message was received and displayed the 2nd time.
Manager.title: Unencrypted MMS Messages Received and Displayed Twice After Delay

Hi Developers at Open Whisper Systems,
Thanks for submitting your app for Android Auto. We reviewed your app, Signal Private Messenger, with package name org.thoughtcrime.securesms, and noticed some eligibility issues.

You can read more about how to support Voice Actions here: https://developer.android.com/training/auto/audio/index.html#support_voice To be considered for Android Auto:
Make the necessary changes to your app. Increment the version number of the upgraded APK. Submit your app for another review. Or, if you‚Äôd like to exclude your app from Android Auto:
Remove the Android Auto manifest entry from your APK code. Sign in to your Developer Console and upload the new APK. Click Submit update. I don't really know what voice commands they're referring to, and I don't have any way to test. Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description App floods phone with nonstop notifications after desktop texting Steps to reproduce Turn off your phone Open the Signal Private Messenger app Do a bunch of texting with the desktop app. Make sure to view all messages sent back at you. Turn on the phone Actual result: Watch your phone flood with notifications - buzzing, etc. It will last for many minutes. In my case, almost 5 full minutes. My phone died, I needed to do a bunch of texting via the webapp, and when I turned the app on again - I basically DOS'ed my own phone. It was going through messages slowly and individually, since it gets the message first, sends the notification, and only then marks its read/unread state. Expected result: From a user experience/product perspective, if I was opening the app after the phone was shutdown (or reception was reentered or whatever), I wouldn't want to see the buzzing, and have to wait. I'd simply see a single notification (or perhaps, no notification at all), and be able to use my phone immediately. tl;dr I shouldn't get a notification at all for a message if it was read on either platform. Screenshots (Not a single event, so no screenshot) Device info Device: Moto X Pure Signal version: 3.27.1 Link to debug log ( Can post this if necessary, but a little uncomfortable with posting the raw debug log atm )
Manager.title: DOS'ing self when turning phone on again after much texting with desktop app

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description On inspecting my own device using adb logcat, I noticed that Signal is writing sensitive personally-identifiable information to logcat. 02-03 16:21:15.603 14609-16502/? W/Directory: Adding active token: +10005550000, REDACTED/+6A Where +1000555000 is the phone number of one of my contacts. There is one line per contact. Steps to reproduce Install Signal Sign in Connect Android device to desktop computer running the Android SDK Use adb shell to inspect logs. Impact If a device is rooted, any app running on the device can have access to read sensitive PII. If the user chooses to submit a bug report for any other unrelated app, even on a factory device, sensitive PII will be leaked. This PII may be uploaded to a phone manufacturer‚Äôs servers for crash report analysis, compromising the security of that user‚Äôs Signal contact list. How to mitigate The offending Log.i should be removed entirely. If that is not desirable, then some attempt must be made to write only a redacted or hashed version of the contacts' phone numbers.
Manager.title: Personally-identifiable information (PII) is being included in logcat logs

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When I am typing a message and moving the cursor around to fix a typo, every now and then the cursor is not responding as it should. You select a position in the message, try to delete a character (by hitting backspace). However not the character at which the cursor is pointing is removed, but the last one in the message. Continuing to correct most of the time results in a crash and restart of Signal. A work around is to exit the message and go back to the entry screen (message saved as draft) opening it again and continue the message. Not sure whether this is a quirk in the keyboard app or in Signal. I have not experienced this on my previous phone (Experia Z3 with Experia keyboard), so it might be keyboard related. Steps to reproduce Unfortunately I have not been able to come up with a sequence of steps to trigger this. A range of messages go OK and then for some reason this weird behaviour occurs. Actual result: Signal crashes Expected result: Signal should not crash on typing or correcting a message. Device info Device: Motorola Z Play Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.28.4 Keyboad used: GBoard - The Google Keyboard Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/ce4ebd92f92f5df67a55600d0ea68dde
Manager.title: Signal crashes when typing a message/moving cursor in message

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When a user reinstalls Signal onto their phone after formatting it, going through the onboarding process creates a new account, instead of restoring the old one. Steps to reproduce install Signal on phone and setup account Link a second device (opt.) Format device (or just delete Signal files) Re-install Signal, and go through the onboarding screen Actual result: A new account is created, which causes all contacts to get a warning about the magic number having changed. If the user does not realise this has happened and continues to use the linked device as well, repeated warnings may result. Expected result: Either the original account should be restored, or the user warned that the old account will be lost. This can also be reproduced by moving the SIM card from a old phone to a new one. Device info Device: Motorola X Force (XT1580) Android version: 6.0 Signal version: 3.28.4
Manager.title: Onboarding Screen should tell user how to add/recover existing account

Manager.description: I have: [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description There are no SAS word pairs visible when placing a call with WebRTC. This is not intended to be a critique of the crypto design or implementation of ZRTP but rather to reflect that two call recipients without knowledge of cryptography expressed concern that not having the SAS could result in possible interception of the calls. The reaction was not related to the technical details of the Signal protocol but rather a sudden, unexplained change in a ritual that accompanied previous usage of the service. At least one call recipient was using the latest iOS beta. I apologize if this is considered more to be a comment than a bug. Steps to reproduce Place WebRTC call Look for previously existing SAS codes Actual result: SAS codes are not visible and there is no explanation for why they are no longer there. Expected result: Either to see the SAS codes or, in the case that they have been purposefully removed, perhaps some other (transitional) visual indication of call security (particularly vis-a-vis tapping or middle attack interception in lieu of the old SAS word pairs. Screenshots Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6P Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.29.2 Link to debug log
Manager.title: Short authentication string (SAS) word pairs not visible on WebRTC calls

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When in the "Update group" screen, the button to tap to finish the update says "CREATE GROUP", while it should say something like "UPDATE" or simply "DONE". In general I don't like the "Update group" wording, it's confusing and doesn't pass the idea of an active action (modifying the group). "Modify group" or "Manage group" would be better. Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Image compression is so high that images become unusable. Steps to reproduce send an image, taken with the standard camera from one device to another, no other steps involved Actual result: Image is compressed from 3264x2448px, 1.5MB to 408x306 px, 36.4KB. Image is not even close to being usable (in this case it is a foto of an time schedule). There is no option available to send the image in a way where it can be used on the recipient side. Seems to be related to #672 (didn't read though it as it is closed and I would expect that to mean resolved) Expected result: Images are received only with mild compression, not affecting the image visibly. Suggestion: Lower the compression rate and allow for the option to send uncompressed images (either via the image send dialogue or introduce an option to send all file types. Last would be fulfilled by #993, which is unfortunately locked for comment. Also I don't like to idea of my data being modified without the possibility to change this. Note: I did not add any further information as I expect this to be device independent. Further information can be provided if needed.
Manager.title: images being compressed beyoned being usable

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The new unread separator looks very clunky (uses much screen space and thus notably reduces the message view "capacity", which is likely to suck on small displays) and has not been adapted to the dark theme. (Since issues with the dark theme most often go along with new features being introduced, the PR contribution template could perhaps be enhanced to include a test with both themes?) Manager.title: Unread/last seen separator looks clunky and is hardly readable using dark theme

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports f-droid repo signed by WhisperSystems Please add an f-droid repo, so people without Google Play Store could have Signal updated on a regular basis. I totally understand and partly agree with @moxie0 's critcism of f-droid security. However, one can address those issues by creating his own f-droid repo and sign it with his own key. Projects that did so include Guardian Project. Information on how this can be done can be found here Why this is important Recently, a very important change has been made - it is now possible to use Signal without Gapps, and that also means that many new Signal users have to download the Signal apk off third party services, like apkpure, which is insecure and makes it impossible to update in a timely manner, which contradicts fundamental believes shared by WhisperSystems team in general and @moxie0 in particular. üëç 20
Manager.title: Add an f-droid repo signed by WhisperSystems

Manager.description: I have: [v ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [v ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I have a dual sim phone running CM13. Signal is set up to replace the default messaging app. The account is set up with the number of my primary sim. In the Android settings sim 2 is set as the default for SMS. When I send an SMS Signal defaults to sim 1 for sending; I have to longpress the send button and select sim 2 to correct that. Even worse, when replying to an SMS received ob sim 2, the app also defaults to sim 1 and sends the reply through that sim. Signal should (1) default to the sim set in the Android settings for sending SMS messages, and (2) use the number that received the original SMS when replying. Device info Device: Xiaomi Redmi Note 3 Android version: 6.0.1 (CM13) Signal version: 3.29.6
Manager.title: SMS sent from wrong sim in dual sim phone

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description If a message fails to send, the red exclamation mark takes one to the details view where the send again button is located. In earlier Signal versions the button disappeared after pressing it and some spinning element or dancing dots appeared, signalling that something is happening. Since a few versions now nothing happens visually after pressing even though Signal is trying to resend the message. This is confusing and leads to pressing the button again and again because nothing seems to be happening. Steps to reproduce Send a message that fails to send for whatever reason click for details press resend button Actual result: Nothing signals the user that something is happening, button stays active all the time Expected result: Deactivate the button and signal that something is happening Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6p Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.29.6 üëç 2

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Using "video calling beta" from an Alcatel TCL 5010D to make a call to a Blackberry Classic with no-google-play-services, on the Alcatel appears this error: "Number not registered - The number you dialed does not support secure voice!". Both devices are running Signal beta 3.30.4. Alcatel has explicitly enabled "video calling beta" feature. Blackberry has it implicitly enabled, as per moxie0's comment in #6272 ("You don't see that settings, it's on by default for you"). [btw, before beta Signal 3.30.3, the Blackberry showed "Login failed!" when trying to place a call; now, from 3.30.3, no more "Login failed!"]. If, instead, I call from the Blackberry the Alcatel, on the Blackberry it seems all ok, ringing tone, but the Alcatel doesnt ring, and shows a missed call just after the Blackberry stops the ringing tone, manually or because of the timeout. Texts and attachments work ok on both directions (A->B, B->A). Alcatel device can place and receive audio calls correctly to/from other Signal accounts. Blackberry device has the same behaviour as detailed here with other Signal accounts. Steps to reproduce call the Blackberry from the Alcatel, and viceversa Device A info Device: Alcatel Pixi4 5010D Android version: 6.0 Signal version: beta 3.30.4 Device B info Device: Blackberry Classic Android version: 4.3 Signal version: beta 3.30.4 Link to debug logs Alcatel calling Blackberry mostly there is, it seems to me, not so much interesting data in the debug log: http://gist.github.com/ea2bc9fb1a190aa5c6a6a4eebfd2feb7 sometimes, something appears [e.g. handleNoSuchUser, I suppose]: http://gist.github.com/f6500cf47918bfa440fb9f665c3ac650 Blackberry calling Alcatel [last 2 account's digits edited to 00 for privacy] http://gist.github.com/6276fdd23691660ad81f3ea340a4f5fa
Manager.title: "Number not registered" when using "calling beta" in 3.30.4 - missing calls instead of ringing, too

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Attempt to send photo or video is unsuccessful, photos are not delivered, which leads to signal messages also not being delivered. To be able to send signal messages again, I must delete the photo I'm trying to send, delete the signal messages that were also not sent and only then I can send signal messages again, but still no photos/gifs. I've been experiencing this problem since today only (no app update today) Steps to reproduce attach photo/gif, press send after some time signal stops trying to send and says "message not delivered" delete photo/gif delete signal messages that were attempted to be sent afterwards now able to send signal messages but still not able to send photos/gifs Actual result: Cannot send photos and gifs Expected result: Able to send cute cat pictures to friends and family Device info Device: Blackberry Priv Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c4cddcf79d721c92ab2cfdc8dddf2b32

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Feature description Most of signal messages I send to my buddies only get delivered( or calls tried notified) when their signal app is opened. This was the case with me until I moved to AOSP and with the new solution for non play services users, now the messages come in very swiftly even when the app is not in foreground. All my buddies are on stock rom and I understand there may be issues with play services configuration etc.. But not everyone are geeks and everyone cannot move to AOSP for different reasons and not everyone can or wants to contact support with debug log when there are good alternatives for instant messaging already installed on their phones. So if the affected users have ability to choose between type of notifying services (GCM PUSH or the WEBSOCKET one), it would simply overcome the issues of no/sluggish notifications and message delivery. üëç 5
Manager.title: Feature Request: Let users choose between GCM PUSH and the new WEBSOCKET based notifying service

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description It has happened a few times now that while I'm having a call I suddenly stop hearing the other party's voice after a while (~several minutes) but they can still hear my voice. So far this has happened only when I'm having a call with Signal iOS. But I haven't had long calls with another Signal Android so nothing to say about that. Steps to reproduce Call Signal iOS device Talk for some time Actual result: Suddenly I stop hearing the other party's voice but they can still hear my voice. Expected result: Both parties can hear each other for the duration of the whole call Device info Android Device: Moto G4 Play Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 iOS Device: iPhone 4S iOS version: 9.3.5 Signal version: 2.7.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/3d87be38fce2a11107b10164322a96bc https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c0102e788ffd853143dbd1ec78a213f1 I guess the relevant parts are before I disconnect the call after I notice that I can't hear the other party anymore Unfortunately, I don't have logs from iOS Related issues In #4532, #6140, #6271 the other party can't hear anything but it seems that the silence is there from the beginning of the call, not after talking successfully for several minutes.
Manager.title: Other party suddenly becomes silent during a call

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Feature description When opening a media item (image, video) in "full" screen from a conversation or the media overview it is currently not possible to swipe to the previous or next media item. It would speed up opening several images in sequence if swiping to the previous and next media item would be supported. Steps to reproduce Open a media item in "full"-screen from a conversation or media overview Swipe from right to left/left to right Actual result: Nothing happens Expected result: If swiped from right to left, the next media item in the conversation is displayed. If swiped from left to right, the previous media item is displayed Screenshots n.a. Device info Device: BQ Aquaris M5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 Link to debug log n.a.

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description My mom has a Moto G3 and she often leaves the screen on when she's in a conversation with me while she's watching TV or whatever. The problem is that while the phone always beeps when she gets a new message, the beep is often really quiet/short when the screen is on and she's already in a conversation with me. "In-conversation notifications" is enabled, which is why it beeps at all. However, it seems the message is marked as "read" too quickly, so the beep is interrupted. My mom is old and she just can't hear the beep which means she can't respond right away when I'm texting her at the supermarket or whatever. Steps to reproduce Receive a message when your screen is on with the chat open, make sure "In-conversation notifications" is enabled in the settings Most of the time the notification beep is really short, which makes it easy to miss Actual result: The beep is seemingly interrupted Expected result: The beep is fully played, just like you'd expect it to Device info Moto G3 Latest non-beta Signal Android 6.0.1 Link to debug log Don't think this is necessary, but if it is just tell me and I'll post one

Manager.description: Debug logs: https://gist.github.com/a2c764a64dcd5c6b0b7cb297554d4c46 Chrome Version 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit) I use multiple user profiles simultaneously to keep work and personal content separate. : installed extensions: Cisco WebEx Extension 1.0.8 Google Docs 0.9 Google Docs Offline 1.4 Google Sheets 1.1 Google Slides 0.9 LastPass: Free Password Manager 4.1.41 Signal Private Messenger 0.32.1 Tampermonkey 4.2.7 OS version: Windows 10 Enterprise Version 1607, OS build 14393.693 Behavior: After upgrading from a windows 7 machine to windows 10, Signal has become unreliable. I see the message popup indicating I've gotten a new message, and about 80% of the time when I click the popup, my chrome instance is highlighted, but the signal instance does not appear. I've enabled, disabled, removed, re-added, re re re,moved , re re added etc a number of times with no change in behavior. Once I have the window open and working, it will continue to work as long as I do not close the window. once I close the window, it's anyone's guess whether it will come back again. Sometimes I have the signal icon showing in the control panel open programs list, where I have attempted to bookmark the signal icon so it is easily accessible: If I hover over the icon and I can see the program preview, signal will work as expected. If the icon will not show up, or hovering does not show the program preview, there is literally nothing I can do to convince the window for signal to show itself. It is obviously running, because I still get the message alerts- but the actual message window can not be accessed. I attempted to go to the extension, and use the "create shortcut" option from the extension window. This will very occasionally work, but it's rare. the shortcut mainly gives me a "working" icon, and then does nothing. I can also go to the "view in store" and select "launch app" from the chrome store. Again, occasionally this will work, but almost never. mostly it just does nothing. I have been paying attention, but I can not find any consistency for when it will work vs when it will not work. It does not seem more likely to work after a reboot or before, And I believe it has randomly started to work in the middle of a browser session (though I'm not 100% sure). The only thing that Has changed about my configuration is the OS version, so I'm sure there is something environmental causing this- but I have not been able to narrow down what triggers the behavior. One more interesting thing I just discovered: It's more likely to work if I use one chorme profile than another. when it fails to work, it always highlights the shortcut to the chrome profile that works less often. The extension shows as installed on both. Perhaps this is a strange side effect of windows 10 + profiles in chrome?
Manager.title: Chrome Desktop app window will not open consistently for windows 10

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Family uses Signal to communicate but Teenager has limited cellular data (e.g. used up monthly quota on YouTube). Other family members cannot send messages to Teenager in a timely fashion without knowing in advance whether Teenager currently has cellular data available. Steps to reproduce Attempt to send Signal message to Teenager Message is sent fine (one tick) Hours later, notice that Teenager has not replied, and message still has only one tick Manually send message via long-press SMS Actual result: Teenager doesn't actually receive the message until it has been manually been sent via SMS Expected result: An app setting should allow automatic fallback to SMS/MMS if the message has not been delivered to the recipient after N minutes. (Signal would ideally need a way to identify when two copies are received, one via SMS/MMS and one via Signal when cellular or Wifi permits the original message to arrive) For many people, the encrypted nature of Signal messages is less important than a single, reliable messaging app, and these people are nonetheless important for growing the Signal user base. (BTW, I found some old bugs about fallback if the senders internet is intermittent, but not the receivers)
Manager.title: Allow auto fallback from Signal message to SMS/MMS

Newly of the shelf bought phone. disabled apps: com.google.android.gms com.android.vending com.google.android.gsf Debug log not available as signup is impossible. A fix would be greatly appreaciated, as it would allow to quickly setup an android burner phone for Signal without much technical sophistication. üëç 5

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When a new user installs Signal, Signal notifies all of their contacts who have Signal that Signal has been installed. This is an invitation to communication which may be unwanted or long outdated. Steps to reproduce Install Signal Get messages from ex-lovers or business associates you have no interest in communicating with Actual result: Signal, without advising me, tells everyone with my phone number stored in their phone that I have installed Signal. Expected result: When I install Signal, it should be my choice if Signal tells everyone who has my phone number, intentionally or not, that I've done so. Screenshots Notification from an OKCupid date 8 years ago. Two suggestions: Allow the new user to choose if these notifications are generated. Only notify a contact that Signal is available when composing a new message to a contact with Signal installed. üëç 1 üëé 1

Manager.description: Improve local storage encryption. Now only the content of the messages is encrypted. If forensics can bypass androids FDE, they can collect metadata. Please don't assume that androids FDE is safer than local encryption implemented right. Android FDE is light years away from ios and even ios is not bulletproof. please read on the discoussion forum: https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/passphrase-encryption-only-for-message-contents/917 Moxie commented he would want to phase it out in favor of android fde. Wich would be a mistake.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Move to SQLCipher so destination information is also encrypted

Manager.description: Let the user put some extra entropy like threema does for the long-term private key.
Manager.title: Feature Request: User generated entropy for private key generation

Actual result: All of my Signal message history was gone. I was able to re-import SMS messages from before installing Signal the first time, over 6 months ago. Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal is unable to send or receive messages over an LTE / 3G connection if NetGuard is active simultaneously on the device. This behaviour persists even if Signal is given full access to both WiFi and cellular connections in NetGuard. This behaviour is unique to cellular data connections. Signal works properly on WiFi while NetGuard is active. It is not yet clear whether the problem is in Signal or in NetGuard. If it turns out to be the latter, then a help / faq page saying "NetGuard breaks Signal, there's just no way to make it work, here are alternatives / workarounds" would be a good idea. Running without NetGuard or a similarly capable alternative is not a workaround, as that would permit other apps to quickly gobble up mobile data (which, in this case, is expensive and in extremely limited supply). Steps to reproduce Debug log attached, generated as follows: While an active WiFi connection is present, close and then start Signal. Verify that NetGuard is set normally (firewall is on, Signal has full access for both WiFi and cellular modes). Move outside the range of the WiFi connection. Device automatically switches to LTE connection. Attempt to send a plain text message in Signal. Actual result: Get a "failed to send message" error. Expected result: Message is sent, shows 1 checkbox (sent), shortly thereafter shows 2 checkboxes (received). Turn off NetGuard entirely. Try sending the message again in signal. Actual result: Message is sent correctly. Expected result: No change. Re-enable NetGuard and move back into WiFi range. Actual result: Signal works normally. Device info Device: LGE Nexus 5 (hammerhead) Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.1.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d9a7d59b0737474aec9191101ee182a5
Manager.title: Signal incompatibility with NetGuard

Manager.description: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submit-only-complete-prs-and-test-them states that folks shouldn't submit work-in-progress PRs. That seems like a very bad idea to me. WIP PRs are very useful for answering questions like: Am I heading down the right direction with respect to this code's design? I implemented part of this change, if I finish the rest would it be accepted? I'm stuck with such-and-such an error, how can I solve it? I've made a change on this line but I'm not 100% sure it's correct, can someone confirm? All of these questions have to go somewhere. It might as well be somewhere where it's easiest to answer - in a Pull Request where you have the full diff available to contextualize all discussion. Does this requirement exist because people would submit incomplete PRs that made tests fail, etc.? In that case, I propose the text be amended to say something like "if submitting a Pull Request that's not ready for merging, prefix its title with [WIP]." üëç 6
Manager.title: "Don't submit WIP PRs" is a bad contributor experience

Manager.description: First of all, I've never come across another app that won't allow the user to bypass the "update play services" popup by clicking outside the popup, and then work as normal, if indeed the app doesn't REQUIRE play services (but still attempts to use it for something). Signal registration fails completely if play services isn't the latest possible version, even if the user has it disabled. You should allow the user to click outside that popup and proceed without updating/using play services if in fact Signal works without it. That's what most apps do if they don't require play services. Second, your comment about Signal being designed to work if play services isn't installed on the device at all is completely facetious. ALL android devices have this installed. The only way to get it completely deleted is to root the device, which thanks to google, can only be done by using third-party apps like Kingroot which is made by unknown people in China and introduces a huge security risk. Therefore, it's only feasible to DISABLE play services, google services framework, the play store, and google account manager. Third, you ask what is the benefit of making play services disabled "if it is some kind of malware." Well, (1) play services constantly phones home to a google domain at 1e100.net. It has complete permissions to your device and, knowing how google is, most likely uploads the user's contacts and files, and may even record audio and video without the user knowing. The mere fact that it has permission to do all of that is a security risk in itself (and opens a backdoor for the government to collude with google to develop spy tools for Android phones). (2) Play services is constantly updating, which I have found can cause major incompatibility issues and brick phones, since google doesn't test the update on every phone in use in the marketplace. Google forces the updates on users, which is unethical and unnecessary if the old version is working. So, hopefully you can see why play services is a major problem. Basically, google treats peoples' phones as if it belonged to google, controlling what can run on the device, forcing updates, accessing god knows what, and constantly phoning home, as any user with a firewall app can see. They act as if they are only "licensing" the phone to the user, rather than the user actually owning the phone and controlling it. Honestly, I would think any developer working on a privacy/security product like Signal would have grasped this already. With regards to publishing annoucements, see: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=13691050 https://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/5v9evr/signal_can_now_be_used_without_google_play/ http://forums.crackberry.com/blackberry-10-apps-f274/official-signal-app-without-play-services-available-1100790/ https://www.wilderssecurity.com/threads/signal-can-now-be-used-without-google-play-services.392235/ https://opensignal.com/android_app/non-market-download.php
Manager.title: Play services issue

Manager.description: Pardon me if this had been already discussed, but I only found one relevant issue, #838. Since TS only supports phone numbers as an identity mechanism, it means the telcos (and hence governments) have all the metadata they need to identify users. Thy don't even care about the communication contents - see Why Metadata Matters | Electronic Frontier Foundation and Using Metadata to find Paul Revere. Thus TextSecure offers a false sense of security. I'd love to be proven wrong if perhaps I misunderstood the underlying handshake and transport mechanisms (SMS, GCM).

Manager.description: I have: [ x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description [Caveat] Please note, I'm not entirely sure this is a bug, as I could see the utility of this behavior, depending on the use-case. When I'm in a group conversation with (in this case) two other users, and I've set the disappearing messages timer to 1 day, if that amount of time passes and no one has sent any messages to the group, not only will the messages disappear (as expected), but the entire group will disappear, no longer showing in the contacts list. Steps to reproduce Create a messaging group with two other Signal users Set disappearing messages timer to 1 day Exchange messages as expected Note that your group appears in your contacts list Allow all messages to expire, with no messages being sent or received by the group for the duration of the disappearing messages timer Note that the created group has disappeared Actual result: Note that the created group has disappeared Expected result: Noting my caveat above, the expected result would normally be that the created group does not disappear without the user manually deleting it. Work-arounds The following work-arounds were found to negate this behavior (assuming you don't want to disable the disappearing messages functionality): When first creating the group, prior to setting the disappearing messages timer, send one message to the group, serving to anchor the group in your contacts list. Once that message has been sent, set the disappearing messages timer, which will automatically delete subsequent messages (excluding the anchor). It is unknown if this will serve to anchor the group with recipients, especially if they manually delete the anchor. Assuming you're using the desktop client, where the group will not disappear once the timer has expired (but messages will), send a message to the group. This will serve to recreate the group on the mobile app. The group will disappear on the mobile app should the timer expire again. App State Signal messages and calls registered SMS/MMS Enabled Notifications on Passphrase on, Screen security on Theme Dark, Language Default Message trimming off 3rd party app info unknown, other than being Signal registered Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6P Android version: 7.1.2, build N2G47H Signal version: 4.4.0 beta Link to debug log Bug(?) was not noticed in a timely fashion, so no debug log was generated.
Manager.title: Setting disappearing messages in a group also removes entire group after messages expire

Manager.description: I have: [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Actually this is not a bug, just proposal for UX improvement. Current sounds (sonar sound and ping when call is established/terminated) are by my opinion too aggressive. They contain too much high tones. My proposal is, to use more soft sounds. My proposal is also to replace sonar sound with something more similar to ringing... for instance instead of sonar there should be "slow" ringing and when ringing starts, there should be regular ringing (as it is now). Another proposal is also to measure bandwidth and quality of call. When quality of call starts to get to low, user should get a very soft beep-beep-beep sound, so he/she is alerted there are problems with bandwidth. This should also be visible on the screen. If connection drops (because of bad connection), it should be re-establisher automatically - user should be alerted of this re-establishing by sound and by screen text. Anyway, I am also noticing some problems with bandwidth consumption. Are there any plans that when bad network conditions occur, codec automatically "switches" to lower quality? I am not talking about VBR codecs, just that maybe there should be two codecs used - one for normal bandwidth and another when bandwidth is lower. üëç 2 üëé 2

Manager.description: Signal should remember that you've verified safety numbers with a contact. When you run into a friend, it's easy to forget whether you've done this or not, and anything to make it more convenient increases security. Some users add a check mark to the contact's name, but this is a terrible solution. This change shouldn't require any new options or settings. It would be nice: for both users to see a "Your safety number with XXX was verified [/ not verified]" message in the conversation in the style that you already see e.g. "Your safety number with XXX has changed" to see an indication of whether the safety number for any given contact has been verified in "Conversation settings > verify safety number", and perhaps also additional info about it e.g. when verification occurred, how ... to have some ongoing visual indication of the verification status within each conversation (maybe the lock and checkmarks could become green instead of grey? or there could be a different color in the title bar or background color?) I'm guessing it's unwise, though, to prevent someone from re-verifying a safety number with a contact in case, e.g., their threat model includes physical tampering Thanks for considering this! üëç 4
Manager.title: Track verified safety numbers

Manager.description: As part of an intermediate threat level(?) model, I'd like to have - like in GO SMS Pro, for example - the passphrase-protection apply only to a subset of my contacts/conversations, which should not affect normal usage of the app for the rest of the conversations in any way. The "sensitive" conversations should only show up and be available to interact with when the passphrase is entered. For this to happen, of course, there needs to be an entirely different handling of the passphrase-protection (or just a new dedicated contacts-hiding passphrase mechanism?) where it doesn't auto-lock the whole app but only some conversations. In this case I should have something like an Unlock option in the Settings menu rather than as the first thing shown on app launch. The scenario I'm thinking of is probably a quite common one, where you expect to forget your phone on a table somewhere and to have people looking through it while you're gone. In that case it's not much of a problem if they can get past the lockscreen but it becomes more important that a few apps or app sections holding sensitive information be really locked down with something more complicated than what's typically available as a screen locker. (If I complicate the screen locker by making it a long PIN or passphrase I severely reduce the usability of my phone, and in my opinion it's the same with my SMS handling app, which should be able to deal with "inocuous" conversations quickly and easily even if I have other conversations that I want to keep under a tighter lock.) As for new message notifications from the hidden contacts, they should have some generic new-message text that doesn't disclose either the contact's name or the contents of what they've sent you. üëç 1 üëé 5
Manager.title: [UX] Passphrase-protect and hide only "sensitive" contacts.

Manager.description: I respect that Signal is trying to improve the state of secure communications and is designed in such a way as to minimize the amount of metadata available to Open Whisper Systems, but because it is not a federated protocol, all Signal users must trust that Open Whisper Systems is telling the truth. While we have no reason to doubt that, it would be better not to have to operate solely on trust. There should be no downside to making Signal's servers world-readable (except for API keys, of course) so that users can verify for themselves that all messages are encrypted and minimal metadata are stored.
Manager.title: [suggestion] Making signal server world readable

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Well the problem i have is some contacts hav tested Signal (on iOS) but have stoped useing the app. Signal stil expect them to use Signal. Since on my P9 I use Signal for all communiction SMS get to Signal conversation flow. If the contact that have passively abadoned signal write an SMS it gets listed and Signal defaults to send them an answer over data service, which the doesent reach the Phone of the SMS message received before. This is very bad. Moste of the time I am aware the person doesnt use Signal and chose SMS to sen dthe message but sometimes I forget it and the to be receiving person is going to be upset because she doesn't receive an answer. Steps to reproduce register mobile number A for signal delete app from phone of user A send an SMS from user A to B B uses Signal Android as SMS App B receives SMS message insecure B knows A has removed Signal from phone and wants to write back but forgets to choose SMS for sending the message A doesn't receive the message because it never contacts the server Actual result: contact doesn't receive an answer Expected result: Either the receiver should get the message over the way he sent it to the receiver or the sender should be made aware the receiver probably doesn't uses signal anymore or sms should be a default option to chose from in contact setting There are some workaround for this drop SMS on Android app altogether (which is a no brainier in myy eyes) make trafic type selection permanent, in user settings, which would just wire up some available functions as defaults (workaround) implement active database , eg a number doesn't communicate once in a (to be defined, weeks/months ) timeframe to the server (connect to server not sending receiving a message) either drop the number from Secure user circle or notify the sender of a data message the chat partner has seen no data usage recently and my not receive the message in time (optimal, but provides probably meta data leak) Device info Device: HUaweii P9 to iPhone 6 Android version: 7.0.0 Signal version: All until to date as of writing üëç 3
Manager.title: user abadoned signal, workaround

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I installed a different ROM for my phone and made a backup of my conversations. After installing the ROM I registered my device and tried to restore the backup. That seemed to work fine but on closer inspection it turned out that group chats had been split into separate conversations, one for each person in the chat. So, for example, if I was in a group chat with Tom and Jerry, I would now have one chat with Tom (with all messages he sent to the group) and one for Jerry (with his messages). The group chat was not restored at all. Steps to reproduce Use Signal like normal (I did use a custom build with layout changes I've been working on with my own signing key, version 4.6.0), participate in group chats Create a backup in Signal Install a custom ROM (Lineage OS in my case). I wiped everything like system, cache, etc, except the internal storage (data) partition. Reinstall Signal Import the backup you've created earlier Actual result: Group chats are imported as separate chats for each person participating in the chat. Expected result: Group chats should be restored the way I backed them up, so all the messages from that group should appear in that group chat. Screenshots Omitted because privacy and I don't have photoshop at hand to do some blurring. Device info Device: Moto X 2014 (victara) xt1092 Android version: 6.0.0 (stock moto) -> 7.1.2 lineage os nightly june 2nd Signal version: 4.6.0 / 4.6.1 Link to debug log Sorry, don't have that.. üëç 2
Manager.title: Backup/restore doesn't properly import group chats

Manager.title: Application crashes on start

Manager.description: Quite often when "sharing" a clipboard (text) with the Signal App I noticed that the text is inappropriate or more simply, I decided not to send this text. I have to mark and delete the text. It would be easier, if the text input has a button(marked with "X" or a delete symbol), so that the text could be quickly deleted by clicking the button or symbol.
Manager.title: [Feature request/Suggestion] Clear text input function (quick "delete text" button)

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When using the desktop app, when a person sends me a message, the chat window jumps to a section of disappearing messages from a week ago. The disappearing timer was set to five minutes. The messages disappeared from my phone correctly, but they are still visible on my computer. The messages have also disappeared on the phone and computer of the account that they were sent to. Manager.description: So here is the idea: now that we have persistent identity verification, an SMS based safety number verification can be implemented. Of course this is not as good as a face-to-face meeting where the numbers are checked, but the only way to perform a MITM is to control both the Signal server and the mobile carrier, in order to manipulate the SMS message exchange. This is very unlikely (remember that the SSL certificate of the server is pinned). I think that an attack of this kind is less likely than getting the device compromised. In this case encryption is not of any help.
Manager.title: SMS based safety number verification

Manager.description: Backgrund: PR #6731. This could be automated like this: The QR code contains the safety number and a random password, valid only while the QR code page is open; Device A scans Device B's QR code, checks the number, marks it as "verified" and sends an acknowledgement message to device B, authenticated by the temporary password; If the password matches, device B sets the number as verified too, as the acknowledgement message can only come from a device that physically scanned the QR code. #1016 deserves some love too. Thanks @moxie0 for the great features 4.7.0 brought. Edit: thinking about it, the "temporary password" probably doesn't need to be temporary at all, just random and per-contact. üëç 1
Manager.title: Automatically check verification status after qrcode scan

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The current isLowMemory code suboptimally uses getMemoryClass instead of getLargeMemoryClass. Since Signal already sets android:largeHeap, the relevant limit is returned by getLargeMemoryClass, as per the Android documentation. I think this is behind the effect where some devices can easily send higher resolution images over other messaging apps (e.g. Whatsapp) but get a rather low memory class rating in Signal and compress the images too much as a result.

I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal APK on website (and likely via Google Play store) is signed with cert that uses a RSA1024 key with SHA1 digest. Unsure if this is actually an issue as it seems likely that you would be aware already but since I couldn't find a prior issue I thought I should raise it. My instinct tells me that changing to a >=2048bit key would break update functionality as the signing certificate digest is pinned in the app. Better safe than sorry to raise this anyway, Livvy Steps to reproduce jarsigner -verify -certs -verbose Signal-website-release-4.8.1.apk Actual result: Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) - Signed by "CN=Whisper Systems, OU=Research and Development, O=Whisper Systems, L=Pittsburgh, ST=PA, C=US" Digest algorithm: SHA1 Signature algorithm: SHA1withRSA, 1024-bit key
jar verified. Expected result: Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) Not necessarily a bug report so not necessarily an "expected" result but in an ideal world: - Signed by "CN=Whisper Systems, OU=Research and Development, O=Whisper Systems, L=Pittsburgh, ST=PA, C=US" Digest algorithm: SHA1 Signature algorithm: SHA256withRSA, 4096-bit key
jar verified. Screenshots Device info Device: N/A Android version: N/A Signal version: 4.8.1 Link to debug log
Manager.title: Weak APK signing key (RSA1024 / SHA1 Digest)

Manager.description: Bug description While registered with Signal on a foreign number, and visiting UAE, Signal does not work so whilst de-registration of foreign number, messages that were not being sent/received are suddenly sent/received in that time window. Is there a possible vulnerability just during that time frame? Steps to reproduce Use a SIM card from a foreign country where Signal is not blocked or censored and register and use it in that country. Go to UAE and use Signal (messages will not be sent) Send a few messages and instantly go to next step Try de-registering (it will give an error of "error connecting to server") Previously sent messages will be delivered whilst the de-registration is happening Messages will not be sent anymore afterwards and de-registration won't happen. Messages sent from outside UAE are also not delivered normally, but are received whilst the UAE user is de-registering. Actual result: So messages are not being sent/received at all.... but then when trying to de-register the messages are sent/received. The main problem here is that during de-registration all messages are sent/received. Expected result: Not sure what I expect, but if Signal is blocked then messages shouldn't go through at all. So maybe it is a security issue, or perhaps there is another way to circumvent censorship? Screenshots Sorry no screenshots as the explanation is self-sufficient (hopefully). Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 4.8.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/b53230b3764cb08ad97ff102088700db
Manager.title: (Possible security issue) Whilst de-registering foreign number in UAE messages, are sent/received

Manager.description: I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates Bug description Scenario: Someone is using Signal, then switches to a new phone but doesn‚Äôt reinstall/re-set up Signal. Issue: I send them a text message through Signal. The lock symbol appears (so the message is being routed through Signal), the first checkmark (the message was sent) appears, but I never get the second checkmark (the message was delivered). I've run into this issue with at least 3 people in the last week. In addition to the problem itself, it is additionally problematic that there is no notification the message was never delivered. I only discover it when I go to text that person again days, or weeks later - and even then it often takes me a few more instances before I notice what's going on. Steps to reproduce Set up Signal on a phone. Drop phone in toilet. Get a new phone, don't set up Signal. Have someone else send you a text message. Actual result: The recipient does not receive any message. The sender does not receive a notification their message failed to deliver. Expected result: Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) The text message would be routed to the recipient's normal text message app, OR... The sender would be notified the text message could not be delivered. Platform info Operating System: LG G6, Android 7.0. Signal version: 4.9.9
Manager.title: Texts not delivered to users who get new phones and don't reinstall Signal

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When attaching an image directly from the camera, a plaintext copy of the image is saved to the folder /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/org.thoughcrime.securesms/files Steps to reproduce Go into any Signal conversation Leave the message empty Press the blue paperclip button (this does not happen when you press the quick camera button) Press the green "Camera" button Take a picture Press the tick or similar button in the camera app to accept the picture No need to continue editing, captioning or sending the image, the file has already been created and is never removed. Even deleting the draft doesn't delete the file. Actual result: A file with a jpg extension is created in the folder /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/org.thoughcrime.securesms/files - the file name is made of the digits of what appears to be ctime of the time the file was created. The file persists throughout the life of the app and never deleted, even when the image in the conversation is deleted or the entire conversation is deleted. Clearing Signal's storage from the app info applet does delete all files in that folder. Expected result: Ideally, No plaintext image file would be created anywhere within the phone's file system Alternatively, the file will be deleted as soon as practicable after it has been encrypted and stored in Signal's database Device info Device: Tested on OnePlus 2 and Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version: Tested under OxygenOS Stock 3.6.0 for Oneplus 2 and Cyanogen 14.1 NIGHTLY for S7 Signal version: 4.9.9 and, based on the pictures left on my device, multiple previous versions üëç 7
Manager.title: Attached image from camera leaves plaintext copy

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Messages sent from signal don't come through to SMS on new phone without signal. The new phone shares the number of an old phone that had signal. My guess is that the number is still registered in the server since signal was never uninstalled from the old phone, so the server tries to route to the app for that number, even though the new phone doesn't have it. Installing signal on the new phone makes new messages come through without trouble. Steps to reproduce buy new phone with new sim card transfer number to new phone don't uninstall signal from old phone don't install signal on new phone Actual result: new phone doesn't get messages sent from signal Expected result: new phone should get messages from signal in default SMS app Device info Device: iPhone 6s (new phone), Galaxy S6 (old phone)

Manager.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Issue copied over from Closed Desktop issue 1424 as requested by @scottnonnenberg Bug description Under the following conditions, messages disappear in an untimely fashion from Signal Android: The message is sent from Signal Desktop (Electron); and The message has an attachment or is a voice message; and The message is sent in a conversation that has the "Disappearing Messages" feature turned on Steps to reproduce Have Signal Android and Signal Desktop (Electron) linked Enter a conversation on Signal Desktop Turn on "Disappearing Messages" if not already on (set the time to 1 day) Send a message with an attachment - or - send a voice message Wait for the message to be sent successfully, reach the recipient successfully (two "tick marks") Watch the same conversation on Signal Android Actual result: The messages are synchronised to Signal Android After around 1-2 minutes, the messages with the attachments disappear from Signal Android Unreproducible: Sometimes the message doesn't show up at all on Signal Android. This happened to me yesterday pretty consistently with voice messages but I can't reproduce that today. I suspect that they might show up and disappear too fast for me to see. Today they behave like other messages with attachments. (the messages do not disappear from Signal Desktop nor do they disappear from the recipient's device) Expected result: The messages are synchronised to Signal Android and stay there for the duration specified in the "Disappearing messages" menu The messages disappear simultaneously from both Signal Desktop and Signal Android when the period specified for "Disappearing messages" has elapsed.
